Issues.Title: Compatibility Issue with Angular 17.3.11 and Module Federation Packages Leading to Dependency Injection Errors
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core, platform-browser

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

I am trying to load a custom plugin with Angular version 17.3.11 but encountering the following issue. This occurs after updating the two packages "@angular-architects/module-federation" and "@angular-architects/module-federation-tools" to version 18.0.4.

TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'firstCreatePass')
    at providersResolver (core.mjs:27484:15)
    at definition.providersResolver (core.mjs:27745:24)
    at N_ (remoteEntry.js:1:2842558)
    at aS (remoteEntry.js:1:2842076)
    at nE (remoteEntry.js:1:2919565)
    at Bh (remoteEntry.js:1:2919719)
    at Module.n_ (remoteEntry.js:1:2920554)
    at template (907.b0dee35ac08d6609.js:1:5554)
    at o0 (remoteEntry.js:1:2838321)
    at g0 (remoteEntry.js:1:2846321)

However, if I revert "@angular-architects/module-federation" and "@angular-architects/module-federation-tools" to version 17.0.8 (which I was using previously with Angular 17.3.5), I encounter a different error even though BrowserModule is already imported.

RuntimeError: NG0402: A required Injectable was not found in the dependency injection tree. If you are bootstrapping an NgModule, make sure that the `BrowserModule` is imported.
    at Object.useFactory (core.mjs:31898:27)
    at Object.factory (core.mjs:3322:38)
    at core.mjs:3219:47
    at runInInjectorProfilerContext (core.mjs:866:9)
    at R3Injector.hydrate (core.mjs:3218:21)
    at R3Injector.get (core.mjs:3082:33)
    at injectInjectorOnly (core.mjs:1100:40)
    at ɵɵinject (core.mjs:1106:60)
    at injectArgs (core.mjs:1237:23)
    at multiRecord.factory (core.mjs:3193:45)

When using Angular 17.3.5, everything works fine. However, once I upgrade my plugin to Angular 17.3.11, it stops working. After some debugging, I found that the issue seems to be related to the @angular/core and @angular/platform-browser packages. If I keep these two package versions at 17.3.5 while upgrading the rest of the Angular packages to 17.3.11, everything works fine.

Issues.Title: docs(docs-infra): Text legibility and accessibility
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced
The new Angular Docs site could do with some improvements in accessibility related to text rendering.  I could not find a single instance of text using subpixel rendering properly (which makes small text look really bad, _especially_ if it isn't max contrast), and there are way too many instances of gradient filled text at small sizes.

Don't get me wrong, the new site _does_ look really cool, but in its current state it looks more like an ad for Angular than actual documentation.

### Describe what you want to experience that would fix the problem
- No gradient fills on \<code\>, period.
- No gradient fills on text smaller than 16px
- Reduce over-reliance on CSS transforms across the site so that the browser can do subpixel rendering

### Add a screenshot if that helps illustrate the problem

Some examples of "bad" text rendering here:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/178fbf90-256f-4d3d-8285-1696b18943b3)
(some of the letters here look really blocky.  also, unnecessary gradient.)

(completely unnecessary gradient that looks bad on small text)

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b088ddf6-c72b-4986-b274-e0601b39815e)

Issues.Title: builder-angular:application - build ssr only, disable ssr from serve
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Description

We are trying to migrate to use `@angular-devkit/build-angular:application` however due to the `ssr` triggering the SSR during `serve` is causing us issues

What we need to have is to be able to disable the ssr handling via vite (ng serve), but build the server only

- no output: SSR output e.g. `dist/server`
- no SSR server: no SSR from dev-server (through vite)

Using the following: **output + SSR server**
```json
"prerender": true,
"ssr": {}
```

Using the following: **no output + SSR server**
```json
"prerender": true,
"ssr": false
```

Using the following: **no output + no SSR server**
```json
"prerender": false,
"ssr": false
```

Just some more context - our SSR is handled via dotnet ATM and changing all the process its not very simple (and needs to work for local/prod). We pass metadata in order to boot up the angular app for configs etc... which we include via provider (and can change dynamically/per request can have different configs e.g. by locale)


### Describe the solution you'd like

Some configuration along these lines

#### via serve opts
```json
"serve": {
  "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:dev-server",
  "options": {
    "disableSsr": true
  }
},
```

#### OR via build
```json
"build": {
  "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:application",
  "options": {
    ...
    "prerender": true,
    "ssr": {
        "devServer": false
    }
  },
```

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Some workarounds

- keep using `"builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:dev-server"` (not sure if theres a new version for this)
- and for the client use either:
    -  `"builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:application"` and disable `ssr+prerendering`
    - or `"builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser-esbuild"`

Issues.Title: Support where *browser* static assets (js,css,assets) are pulled from
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Description

Right now, we're running to a lot of "Chunk loading errors" when using CI/CD with Angular and Angular's SSR. The reason for this is because our CDN reaches out to origin to get static assets, which are served from SSR. As soon as a new build goes out, the CDN is cleared, and the new assets are now live.

This causes issues with people currently on the site as lazy-loaded chunks that are still wanting to be requested in the users browser will try to go back to origin, only for the CDN to find out they no longer exists because chunk file hashes changed, and trigger the "Chunk loading errors" we're constantly seeing.

In order for users to fix this, they must do a hard-refresh, something we do not want our users to have to go through, especially since we're an international company and at any point in time, we can have people millions of people on in any of our regions.

### Describe the solution you'd like

I would like to be able to configure where **browser** static assets are pulled. One solution we thought of is to be able to change the URL where browser assets are pulled from. Think of it like this:

1.) Build 5000 triggers. We somehow prefix in the CLI that **browser ** assets should be loaded from `https://my.cdn.com/5000/`. We then upload all the browser assets from the build to the `/5000` directory in our CDN.
2.) Build 5001 triggers. We somehow prefix in the CLI that **browser ** assets should be loaded from `https://my.cdn.com/5001/`. We then upload all the browser assets from the build to the `/5000` directory in our CDN.

If user was currently on 5000, the static assets from the `/5000` folder can still be loaded from our domain. If the user refreshes, and we had cleared our CDN, they would start getting `/5001` requests because the main html changed.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

As it stands right now, we're thinking about just doing a find and replace on any `./chunk` string in the output dist for `/browser` and doing this ourselves. I'm not sure if the Google team has ran into this, I'm sure they have, but I would also welcome any other solutions you guys come up with. The easiest though, would be to allow us to configure this somehow so that server assets always load locally, but browser assets can be changed where you serve them from.

7. In this context even though `myControl.value` is still `One` and `One` *is* visible in the list of options it is no longer marked as selected




### Expected Behavior

I would expect that when `myControl.value` matches a displayed option that option should be marked as selected. At least when `requireSelection=true`. 

For `requireSelection=false` I would expect one of two options. Either it should snapshot the `myControl.value` on `open` for purposes of 'selected marking'; as is done for `requireSelection=true`. Or it should just update 'selected' according to the actual exact value of the underlying control. Overall the latter seems more in line with what is likely actually wanted (as the model *is* that option at that particular point in time). 

### Actual Behavior

As soon as the filter was reduced down to `''` (empty string) the 'selected' value ui markings are removed. 
This same behavior also occurs if you add to your filter string to no longer include your element of selection in the options list and then revert to something that does. (Ie a filter of `One` -> `Onex` -> `One` will have caused your 'selected' element to have been unset)

Once removed the 'selected' highlight and checkmark in the ui seems to ONLY be able to fixed by reselecting an element.

There seem to be several related bugs such as
[selection indicator broken with mat-optgroup ](https://github.com/angular/components/issues/29189)
[updates to the control not being reflected in selection indicators](https://github.com/angular/components/issues/27861)
[initial form control values are not reflected on selection indicators](https://github.com/angular/components/issues/29422)

This ticket is specifically about the causing the selection indicator ui to fail based on the editing of the filter but it seems likely that the same underlying library fix may apply to many if not all of these other tickets.

### My current workarround
I am identifying the option I want 'selected' 'manually' and styling it appropriately. If you go this route make sure to set `hideSingleSelectorIndicator` to true as you do not want to deal with library provided checkmark that sometimes (but not always) shows up.


### Environment

- Angular: 18.2.2
- CDK/Material: 18.2.2
- Browser(s): Chrome 126.0.6478.183
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOs

### Actual Behavior

- Each time the above steps are repeated, a pair of detached elements (the host element of Component A and a `cdk-overlay` div) is created.

Issues.Title: bug(COMPONENT): mat-slider freezes after initial vertical movement on touch device
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14

### Description

I am working on an app that requires a vertical slider. I use CSS to achieve a vertical slider using mat-slider despite it not being supported since v15. This works perfectly on a device with a mouse. However, when using the app on Android, dragging the sliders becomes frozen if the initial translation direction is vertical. Please see the video for an example.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5d776a4a-41d6-42e1-a7be-2ad137d55779



### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://components-issue-dcm346.stackblitz.io
StackBlitz editor: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-dcm346?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.html
Steps to reproduce:
1. In Chrome, open dev console and activate device toolbar (Ctrl+ Shift+ M). Select a touch device.
2. Drag the sliders thumb first perpendicular to the track then parallel to the track.
3. On touch device: If the drag direction is initially vertical, then the slider becomes frozen and no additional movement is allowed. (unexpected behavior)
4. On mouse device: If the drag direction is initially vertical, then the slider still freely moves. (expected behavior)

### Expected Behavior

On touch devices, if the drag movement is initially vertical, the slider thumb should move according to translation parallel to the track.

### Actual Behavior

On touch devices, if the drag movement is initially vertical, the slider thumb becomes frozen to translation parallel to the track.

_No response_

### Description

Hi there,

I’ve been working with CdkContextMenuTrigger in conjunction with CdkMenu and attempting to implement a copy/paste feature. However, I’ve encountered an issue specifically in Firefox: when the context menu opens, the selected text is unexpectedly unselected.

After some investigation, it appears that Firefox may automatically deselect text when focus shifts to elements outside the text container. While this behavior might be a limitation inherent to Firefox, I believe it is worth documenting.

Additionally, it is worth noting that the official CDK context menu example includes mocked "copy" and "cut" options, which exacerbates this issue.

Is this behavior something that can be addressed, or is it an inherent limitation of how Firefox handles text selection and focus?

Thanks!
